model

Class GameOfLife

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.GameOfLife

  • public class GameOfLife
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameOfLife class represents the logic behind this implementation of Conway's Game of Life.

    A GameOfLife object keeps track of the number of generations, the current playing rules and decides the values of the next generations cell grid.

      • GameOfLife

    • Method Detail

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        Sets the next generation of cells as the current play board. Calls on Boards countNeighbours() and sets it as a 2D-array. If the Board is an instance of DynamicBoard it checks if it needs to expand, and expands if yes. Calls on enforceRules() and finally sets the new generation as the current play board.
        See Also:
        enforceRules(), neighbourCount, newGenerationCells, Board.resetCellsAlive(), Board.setBoard(byte[][]), Board.countNeighbours(), DynamicBoard.expandBoardDuringRunTime()

      • nextGenerationConcurrent

        public void nextGenerationConcurrent()
        Sets the next generation of cells as the current play board concurrently. If the Board is an instance of DynamicBoard it checks if it needs to expand, and expands if yes. Calculates the number of rows each thread should consider, and calls generateCallables() to update the Callable objects for this generation. Because of how Board's countNeighbours method works, it needs to make sure that the neighbours have been counted before enforcing the rules and setting the new board. Therefore there are two calls to ThreadWorker' runWorkers() method, which will execute all threads and wait for them to finish.
        See Also:
        newGenerationCells, rowsPerWorker, neighbourCount, generateCallables(), ThreadWorker.runWorkers(Callable), Board.resetCellsAlive(), DynamicBoard.expandBoardDuringRunTime()

      • enforceRules

        public void enforceRules()
        A method for enforcing the rules of the game. Iterates throughout the entire cell grid and calls updateNewGenerationCells() to enforce the rules of the game.
        See Also:
        newGenerationCells, Board.getWidth(), Board.getHeight()

      • setRuleString

        public void setRuleString(java.lang.String input)
                   throws RulesFormatException
        Method to set the rules from a number of presets. Checks what the user has selected, and sets the ruleString accordingly. Does a call to setRuleSet at the end to update the rules.
        Parameters:
        input - The string containing either the name of the rule, or the rule formatted after RLE standards.
        Throws:
        RulesFormatException - - Thrown if the rules are formatted wrong.
        See Also:
        ruleString, ruleDescription, ruleName, setRuleSet(String)

      • setRuleSet

        public void setRuleSet(java.lang.String rules)
        Method to set the rules from a string. Does a check for the right formatting and sets the ruleString, surviveRules and bornRules if the string contains valid information. If not, it shows a popup explaining to the user that the rules are formatted wrongly, and sets the rules to the standard Life rules.
        Parameters:
        rules - The string containing the rules formatted in the RLE-style (Bxxx/Sxxx).
        See Also:
        ruleString, bornRules, surviveRules, PopUpAlerts.ruleAlert1()

      • setThreadWorkers

        public void setThreadWorkers(ThreadWorker tw)

        Parameters:
        tw - The ThreadWorker object to be set.
        See Also:
        workers

        See Also:

      • nextGenerationPrintPerformance

        public void nextGenerationPrintPerformance()
